> I am Associate professor at [HEC MontrÃ©al](https://www.hec.ca/en/profs/amine.ouazad.html)'s Department of Economics. My research was cited in [Congressional hearings](https://youtu.be/c9lrud-Uaok?t=2610), in the Financial Times, Wall Street Journal, [New York Times](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/12/07/business/economy/mortgages-climate-risk-fannie-freddie.html), CBS, Bloomberg, Politico, etc.  I serve on the [scientific](https://www.areuea.org/international) and [awards committees](https://www.areuea.org/awards-committee) of the American Real Estate and Urban Economics Association, and the scientific committee of the [Urban Economics Association](https://urbaneconomics.org/meetings/). Previously I was an associate professor at Ecole polytechnique, France, an associate professor at Rutgers Business School, New Jersey, and an assistant professor at INSEAD, Fontainebleau. In April 2020, I was appointed DLA Piper Distinguished Visiting Professor of Economics at Johns Hopkins University. I was a Senior Fellow of Johns Hopkins' 21st Century Cities Initiative. I taught over 5,000 students, across Canada, the United Kingdom, France, Singapore, South Africa, and the United Arab Emirates, in the EMBA, MBA, PhD, MSc, BComm and BSc undergraduate programs. [Email me](mailto:amine.ouazad@hec.ca)
